Appendix B Proof of TheoremÂ 1

In this section, we provide a detailed proof of TheoremÂ 1, which is carried out in three key steps. The core idea of the proof involves leveraging the properties of a continuous-time Markov chain with an absorbing state, where the forward diffusion process is independent across different dimensions. This independence simplifies the analysis of both the conditional and joint distributions.

First, we derive the analytic form of the conditional distribution, as stated in LemmaÂ 1. This can be derived directly from Eq.Â 2.3, but for a better understanding, we provide a more intuitive proof for ğ‘¸t=Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢ğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¸ğ‘¡ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¸absorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Second, we extend this analysis to multiple dimensions to obtain the joint distribution, as formalized in PropositionÂ 1. Finally, by simply dividing the joint distributions derived in the second step, we decouple the concrete score, thereby completing the proof of TheoremÂ 1.

Lemma 1.

(Analytic conditional distribution in absorbing diffusion) Suppose {Xt}subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘¡\{X_{t}\}{ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a continuous time Markov chain with transition rate matrix ğt=Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢ğabsorbsubscriptğğ‘¡ğœğ‘¡superscriptğabsorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, given the value x0subscriptğ‘¥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time zero , the conditional distribution pt|0â¢(xt|x0)subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥0p_{t|0}(x_{t}|x_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) has the following analytic form:

pt|0â¢(xt|x0)={eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t),xt=x0,1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t),xt=[M],0,xtâ‰ [M]â¢andâ¢xtâ‰ x0.subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥0casessuperscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥01superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡delimited-[]M0subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡delimited-[]Mandsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥0p_{t|0}(x_{t}|x_{0})=\begin{cases}e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}=x_{0},\\ 1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}=[\textbf{M}],\\ 0,&x_{t}\neq[\textbf{M}]\ \text{and}\ x_{t}\neq x_{0}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  [ M ] and italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (B.1)
Proof.

Given the initial value x0âˆˆğ’³={1,â‹¯,N}subscriptğ‘¥0ğ’³1â‹¯ğ‘x_{0}\in\mathcal{X}=\{1,\cdots,N\}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_X = { 1 , â‹¯ , italic_N }, we have

xt={x0,t<Th,[M],tâ‰¥Th.subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡casessubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‡â„delimited-[]Mğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‡â„x_{t}=\begin{cases}x_{0},&t<T_{h},\\ [\textbf{M}],&t\geq T_{h}.\end{cases}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_t < italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL [ M ] , end_CELL start_CELL italic_t â‰¥ italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (B.2)

Here, Thsubscriptğ‘‡â„T_{h}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the holding time before x0subscriptğ‘¥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT transitions to the absorbing state [M].

Based on the definition of the ğ‘¸tsubscriptğ‘¸ğ‘¡{\bm{Q}}_{t}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in Eq.Â 2.2 and ğ‘¸absorbsuperscriptğ‘¸absorb{\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the probability of x0subscriptğ‘¥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT remaining the same after a small time increment Î”â¢tÎ”ğ‘¡\Delta troman_Î” italic_t is

pt+Î”â¢t|tâ¢(x0|x0)=1+Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)â¢Î”â¢t+oâ¢(Î”â¢t).subscriptğ‘ğ‘¡conditionalÎ”ğ‘¡ğ‘¡conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥01ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0Î”ğ‘¡ğ‘œÎ”ğ‘¡p_{t+\Delta t|t}(x_{0}|x_{0})=1+\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})% \Delta t+o(\Delta t).italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t + roman_Î” italic_t | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 1 + italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_Î” italic_t + italic_o ( roman_Î” italic_t ) . (B.3)

Partitioning the interval [0,t]0ğ‘¡[0,t][ 0 , italic_t ] into {sk}k=0nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜ğ‘˜0ğ‘›\{s_{k}\}_{k=0}^{n}{ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and utilizing the memoryless property of continuous-time Markov chains, we can express the probability of x0subscriptğ‘¥0x_{0}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT remaining the same from time 0 to tğ‘¡titalic_t as a product of probabilities over these small intervals. This gives us:

pt|0â¢(x0|x0)subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0\displaystyle p_{t|0}(x_{0}|x_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆk=1npsk|skâˆ’1â¢(x0|x0)absentsuperscriptsubscriptproductğ‘˜1ğ‘›subscriptğ‘conditionalsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0\displaystyle=\prod_{k=1}^{n}p_{s_{k}|s_{k-1}}(x_{0}|x_{0})= âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (B.4)
=âˆk=1n(1+Ïƒâ¢(tkâˆ’1)â¢ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)â¢(skâˆ’skâˆ’1)+oâ¢(skâˆ’skâˆ’1))absentsuperscriptsubscriptproductğ‘˜1ğ‘›1ğœsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1\displaystyle=\prod_{k=1}^{n}\left(1+\sigma(t_{k-1}){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x% _{0},x_{0})(s_{k}-s_{k-1})+o(s_{k}-s_{k-1})\right)= âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) (B.5)
=expâ¡(âˆ‘k=1nlnâ¡(1+Ïƒâ¢(tkâˆ’1)â¢ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)â¢(skâˆ’skâˆ’1)+oâ¢(skâˆ’skâˆ’1)))absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘›1ğœsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1\displaystyle=\exp\left(\sum_{k=1}^{n}\ln\left(1+\sigma(t_{k-1}){\bm{Q}}^{% \text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})(s_{k}-s_{k-1})+o\left(s_{k}-s_{k-1}\right)\right)\right)= roman_exp ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln ( 1 + italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) ) (B.6)
=expâ¡(âˆ‘k=1nÏƒâ¢(tkâˆ’1)â¢ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)â¢(skâˆ’skâˆ’1)+oâ¢(skâˆ’skâˆ’1)).absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘›ğœsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘˜1superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜1\displaystyle=\exp\left(\sum_{k=1}^{n}\sigma(t_{k-1}){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(% x_{0},x_{0})(s_{k}-s_{k-1})+o(s_{k}-s_{k-1})\right).= roman_exp ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_o ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) . (B.7)

Let maxâ¡(skâˆ’skâˆ’1)â†’0â†’subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘ ğ‘˜10\max(s_{k}-s_{k-1})\to 0roman_max ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â†’ 0 , the Riemann sum in Eq.Â B.7 equals the following continuous integral:

pt|0â¢(x0|x0)=expâ¡(âˆ«0tÏƒâ¢(s)â¢ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)â¢ğ‘‘s)=expâ¡(ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)â¢ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)).subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0superscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡ğœğ‘ superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0differential-dğ‘ superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0Â¯ğœğ‘¡p_{t|0}(x_{0}|x_{0})=\exp\left(\int_{0}^{t}\sigma(s){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x% _{0},x_{0})ds\right)=\exp\left({\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})\bar{% \sigma}(t)\right).italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_exp ( âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ( italic_s ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_s ) = roman_exp ( bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) ) . (B.8)

By Eq.Â 2.9, ğ‘¸absorbâ¢(x0,x0)=âˆ’1superscriptğ‘¸absorbsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥01{\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}(x_{0},x_{0})=-1bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = - 1, we have

pt|0â¢(x0|x0)=Pâ¢(Th>t)=eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘ƒsubscriptğ‘‡â„ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡\displaystyle p_{t|0}(x_{0}|x_{0})=P(T_{h}>t)=e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_t ) = italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (B.9)
pt|0â¢([M]|x0)=Pâ¢(Thâ‰¤t)=1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionaldelimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘ƒsubscriptğ‘‡â„ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡\displaystyle p_{t|0}([\textbf{M}]|x_{0})=P(T_{h}\leq t)=1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( [ M ] | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_P ( italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_t ) = 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (B.10)
pt|0â¢(k|x0)=0ifâ¢kâ‰ [M]â¢andâ¢kâ‰ x0.formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥00ifğ‘˜delimited-[]Mandğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥0\displaystyle p_{t|0}(k|x_{0})=0\quad\text{if}\ k\neq[\textbf{M}]\ \text{and}% \ k\neq x_{0}.italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_k | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 0 if italic_k â‰  [ M ] and italic_k â‰  italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (B.11)

Similarly, given value xssubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ x_{s}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT at time s<tğ‘ ğ‘¡s<titalic_s < italic_t, the conditional distribution can be expressed as

pt|sâ¢(xt|xs)={eâˆ’(ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)âˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(s)),xt=xs,1âˆ’eâˆ’(ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)âˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(s)),xt=[M],0,xtâ‰ [M]â¢andâ¢xtâ‰ xs.subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡ğ‘ conditionalsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ casessuperscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡Â¯ğœğ‘ subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ 1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡Â¯ğœğ‘ subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡delimited-[]M0subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡delimited-[]Mandsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ p_{t|s}(x_{t}|x_{s})=\begin{cases}e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)% \right)},&x_{t}=x_{s},\\ 1-e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)\right)},&x_{t}=[\textbf{M}],\\ 0,&x_{t}\neq[\textbf{M}]\ \text{and}\ x_{t}\neq x_{s}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_s ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_s ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  [ M ] and italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (B.12)

âˆ

Proposition 1.

(Analytic joint distribution in absorbing diffusion)

Suppose {Xt}subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘¡\{X_{t}\}{ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a continuous time Markov chain with transition rate matrix ğt=Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢ğabsorbsubscriptğğ‘¡ğœğ‘¡superscriptğabsorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For ğ±t=xt1â¢â‹¯â¢xtdsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡1â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘‘{\bm{x}}_{t}=x_{t}^{1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with d1subscriptğ‘‘1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT components as [M]delimited-[]M[\textbf{M}][ M ] and d2=dâˆ’d1subscriptğ‘‘2ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘‘1d_{2}=d-d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_d - italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT components as unmasked tokens, ptâ¢(ğ±t)subscriptğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptğ±ğ‘¡p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be expressed as

ptâ¢(ğ’™t)=[1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)]d1â¢[eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)]d2â¢p0â¢(ğ’™tUM),subscriptğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘¡superscriptdelimited-[]1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘1superscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘2subscriptğ‘0superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡UMp_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})=[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{1}}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_% {2}}p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}),italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = [ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (B.13)

where ğ±tUMsuperscriptsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡UM{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the vector consists of all unmasked tokens of ğ±tsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

PropositionÂ 1 shows that the joint distribution ptâ¢(ğ’™t)subscriptğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘¡p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be expressed as the multiplication of two terms. One is an analytic term only depending on time, the other is a d2subscriptğ‘‘2d_{2}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT dimensions joint distribution of clean data p0â¢(ğ’™tUM)subscriptğ‘0superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡UMp_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) independent of time.

Proof.

Without loss of generality, letâ€™s assume that the preceding d1subscriptğ‘‘1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT terms of ğ’™ğ’™{\bm{x}}bold_italic_x are all [M], and the remaining d2subscriptğ‘‘2d_{2}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT terms are unmasked tokens. That is, ğ’™t=[M]â¢â‹¯â¢[M]â¢xtd1+1â¢â‹¯â¢xtdsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡delimited-[]Mâ‹¯delimited-[]Msuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘11â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘‘{\bm{x}}_{t}=[\textbf{M}]\cdots[\textbf{M}]x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ M ] â‹¯ [ M ] italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and here xksuperscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜x^{k}italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is an unmasked token in ğ’³ğ’³\mathcal{X}caligraphic_X.

Using the law of total probability and Lemma 1, along with the assumption of independence between different dimensions of the diffusion process, we can express the joint distribution ptâ¢([M]â¢â‹¯â¢[M]â¢xtd1+1â¢â‹¯â¢xtd)subscriptğ‘ğ‘¡delimited-[]Mâ‹¯delimited-[]Msuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘11â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘‘p_{t}([\textbf{M}]\cdots[\textbf{M}]x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( [ M ] â‹¯ [ M ] italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) as a sum over all possible initial states ğ’™0âˆˆğ’³dsubscriptğ’™0superscriptğ’³ğ‘‘{\bm{x}}_{0}\in\mathcal{X}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT:

=\displaystyle== [1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)]d1â¢[eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)]d2â¢p0â¢(xtd1+1â¢â‹¯â¢xtd).superscriptdelimited-[]1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘1superscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘2subscriptğ‘0superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘11â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘‘\displaystyle[1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{1}}[e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}]^{d_{2}}p_{% 0}(x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}).[ 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

By noting that p0â¢(xtd1+1â¢â‹¯â¢xtd)=p0â¢(ğ’™tUM)subscriptğ‘0superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘‘11â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘0superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡UMp_{0}(x_{t}^{d_{1}+1}\cdots x_{t}^{d})=p_{0}({\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), in the general case, we have

Proof.

âˆ

Appendix C Proof of TheoremÂ 2

See 2

Here, the infinity final total noise level guarantees that all tokens will be finally masked with probability one (1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(T)1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘‡1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(T)}1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_T ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT). Below we present the detailed proof in three steps.

C.1 Equivalence between DSE loss and t-DCE loss

For a given noisy input ğ’™tsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, as established in SectionÂ 3.1, ğ’™^tsubscript^ğ’™ğ‘¡{\hat{{\bm{x}}}_{t}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is valid only when it contains exactly one more unmasked token than ğ’™tsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡{\bm{x}}_{t}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In this case, the transition probability ğ‘¸tâ¢(ğ’™^t,ğ’™t)subscriptğ‘¸ğ‘¡subscript^ğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘¡{\bm{Q}}_{t}\left({\hat{{\bm{x}}}_{t}},{\bm{x}}_{t}\right)bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) equals Ïƒâ¢(t)ğœğ‘¡\sigma(t)italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ). Replace ğ’”Î¸â¢(ğ’™t)subscriptğ’”ğœƒsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡{\bm{s}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_{t})bold_italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) with eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ’„Î¸â¢(ğ’™t)superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ’„ğœƒsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_% {t})divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), we can express the DSE loss in the multi-dimensional case as follows:

â„’DSETâ¢(ğ’™0)superscriptsubscriptâ„’DSEğ‘‡subscriptğ’™0\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\textrm{DSE}}^{T}({\bm{x}}_{0})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT DSE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆ«0Tğ”¼ğ’™tâˆ¼pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)[âˆ‘xti=[M],jâ‰ [M]Ïƒ(t)(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)ğ’„Î¸(ğ’™t)[i,j]\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)% \left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({% \bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right.\right.= âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j â‰  [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ italic_i , italic_j ]
âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)ğ•€(x0i=j)log(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)ğ’„Î¸(ğ’™t)[i,j])+K(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)I(x0i=j)))]dt\displaystyle\left.\left.-\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}% \mathbb{I}(x_{0}^{i}=j)\log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma% }(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right)+K\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma% }(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}I(x_{0}^{i}=j)\right)\right)\right]dt- divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ italic_i , italic_j ] ) + italic_K ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) ) ) ] italic_d italic_t
=âˆ«0Tğ”¼ğ’™tâˆ¼pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xti=[M],jâ‰ [M]Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ’„Î¸â¢(ğ’™t)â¢[i,j])]â¢ğ‘‘tabsentsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘‡subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]Mğ‘—delimited-[]Mğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ’„ğœƒsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘—differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}\sigma(t)% \left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({% \bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right)\right]dt= âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j â‰  [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG bold_italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ italic_i , italic_j ] ) ] italic_d italic_t
+âˆ«0Tğ”¼ğ’™tâˆ¼pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xti=[M],jâ‰ [M]âˆ’Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ•€â¢(x0i=j)â¢logâ¡(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ’„Î¸â¢(ğ’™t)â¢[i,j])]â¢ğ‘‘tsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘‡subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]Mğ‘—delimited-[]Mğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡ğ•€superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–ğ‘—superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ’„ğœƒsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘—differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle+\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{% \sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\mathbb{I}(x_{0}^{i}=j)% \log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}% ({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right)\right]dt+ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j â‰  [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - We analyze each term in the above equation separately. (C.1)

(C.2)

Combining the first and third terms:

=\displaystyle== âˆ«0Tdâ¢(1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t))â¢Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢(logâ¡eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t))â¢ğ‘‘tsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘‡ğ‘‘1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle\int_{0}^{T}d(1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)})\sigma(t)\frac{e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\left(\log\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\right)dtâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) italic_d italic_t (C.4)

(C.5)

Introducing a new variable Î»â¢(t)=1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)ğœ†ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡\lambda(t)=1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_Î» ( italic_t ) = 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which represents the probability of a token being masked from 00 to tğ‘¡titalic_t in the forward process. As ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)=âˆ«0tÏƒâ¢(Ï„)â¢ğ‘‘Ï„Â¯ğœğ‘¡superscriptsubscript0ğ‘¡ğœğœdifferential-dğœ\bar{\sigma}(t)=\int_{0}^{t}\sigma(\tau)d\tauoverÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) = âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ïƒ ( italic_Ï„ ) italic_d italic_Ï„ and ÏƒÂ¯â¢(T)=âˆÂ¯ğœğ‘‡\bar{\sigma}(T)=\inftyoverÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_T ) = âˆ, we have Î»â¢(0)=0ğœ†00\lambda(0)=0italic_Î» ( 0 ) = 0, Î»â¢(T)=1ğœ†ğ‘‡1\lambda(T)=1italic_Î» ( italic_T ) = 1 and dâ¢Î»=Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢dâ¢tğ‘‘ğœ†ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡ğ‘‘ğ‘¡d\lambda=\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}dtitalic_d italic_Î» = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_t. Obviously, Î»â¢(t)ğœ†ğ‘¡\lambda(t)italic_Î» ( italic_t ) is invertible, which allows us to perform a change of variables from tğ‘¡titalic_t to Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î» and simplifies Eq.Â C.5 to

dâ¢âˆ«01logâ¡1âˆ’Î»Î»â¢dâ¢Î»=âˆ’dâ¢(Î»â¢logâ¡Î»+(1âˆ’Î»)â¢logâ¡(1âˆ’Î»))|01=0.ğ‘‘superscriptsubscript011ğœ†ğœ†ğ‘‘ğœ†evaluated-atğ‘‘ğœ†ğœ†1ğœ†1ğœ†010\displaystyle d\int_{0}^{1}\log\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda}d\lambda=-d\left(% \lambda\log\lambda+(1-\lambda)\log(1-\lambda)\right)|_{0}^{1}=0.italic_d âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Î» end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG italic_d italic_Î» = - italic_d ( italic_Î» roman_log italic_Î» + ( 1 - italic_Î» ) roman_log ( 1 - italic_Î» ) ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0 . (C.6)

Here we used

limÎ»â†’0Î»â¢logâ¡Î»=limÎ»â†’1(1âˆ’Î»)â¢logâ¡(1âˆ’Î»)=0.subscriptâ†’ğœ†0ğœ†ğœ†subscriptâ†’ğœ†11ğœ†1ğœ†0\lim_{\lambda\to 0}\lambda\log\lambda=\lim_{\lambda\to 1}(1-\lambda)\log(1-% \lambda)=0.roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» roman_log italic_Î» = roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» â†’ 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_Î» ) roman_log ( 1 - italic_Î» ) = 0 .

Thus, the DSE loss reduces to the second term, which we define as the tğ‘¡titalic_t-denoising cross-entropy loss (tâ¢-DCEğ‘¡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE):

â„’tâ¢-DCETâ¢(ğ’™0)superscriptsubscriptâ„’ğ‘¡-DCEğ‘‡subscriptğ’™0\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{t\textrm{-DCE}}^{T}({\bm{x}}_{0})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t -DCE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =âˆ«0Tğ”¼ğ’™tâˆ¼pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xti=[M],jâ‰ [M]âˆ’Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ•€â¢(x0i=j)â¢logâ¡(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ’„Î¸â¢(ğ’™t)â¢[i,j])]â¢ğ‘‘tabsentsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘‡subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptformulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]Mğ‘—delimited-[]Mğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡ğ•€superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–ğ‘—superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ’„ğœƒsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡ğ‘–ğ‘—differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}],j\neq[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{% \sigma(t)e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\mathbb{I}(x_{0}^{i}=j)% \log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}% ({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,j]\right)\right]dt= âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , italic_j â‰  [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - divide start_ARG italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG blackboard_I ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_j ) roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - =âˆ«0Tğ”¼ğ’™tâˆ¼pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xti=[M]âˆ’Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢logâ¡(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢ğ’„Î¸â¢(ğ’™t)â¢[i,x0i])]â¢ğ‘‘tabsentsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘‡subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]Mğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ’„ğœƒsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–differential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{\bm{c}}_{\theta}({\bm{x}}_{t})[i,x_{0}^{i}]\right)\right]dt= âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - =âˆ«0Tğ”¼ğ’™tâˆ¼pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xti=[M]âˆ’Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢logâ¡(eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)â¢qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™tUM))]â¢ğ‘‘t.absentsuperscriptsubscript0ğ‘‡subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]Mğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡subscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡UMdifferential-dğ‘¡\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{T}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{t}\sim p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{% \bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{t}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\frac{\sigma(t)e^{-\bar{% \sigma}(t)}}{1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}\log\left(\frac{e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}{1-e^% {-\bar{\sigma}(t)}}q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{t}^{\textrm{UM}})\right)% \right]dt.= âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - C.2 Equivalence between t-DCE loss and lambda-DCE loss

Starting from the tâ¢-DCEğ‘¡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE loss in Eq.Â 3.4, we can perform a change of variable from tğ‘¡titalic_t to Î»â¢(t)=1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)ğœ†ğ‘¡1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡\lambda(t)=1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)}italic_Î» ( italic_t ) = 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, as demonstrated in SectionÂ C.1. This allows us to rewrite the tâ¢-DCEğ‘¡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE loss integral in terms of Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î»:

âˆ«011Î»â¢ğ”¼ğ’™Î»âˆ¼pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xÎ»i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡(1âˆ’Î»Î»â¢qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™Î»UM))]â¢ğ‘‘Î»superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–delimited-[]M1ğœ†ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğœ†UMdifferential-dğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p% _{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[% \textbf{M}]}-\log\left(\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda}q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_% {\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right)\right]d\lambdaâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Î» end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ] italic_d italic_Î»
=\displaystyle== âˆ«011Î»â¢ğ”¼ğ’™Î»âˆ¼pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xÎ»i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™Î»UM)]â¢ğ‘‘Î»+âˆ«011Î»â¢ğ”¼ğ’™Î»âˆ¼pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xÎ»i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡(1âˆ’Î»Î»)]â¢ğ‘‘Î».superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğœ†UMdifferential-dğœ†superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–delimited-[]M1ğœ†ğœ†differential-dğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p% _{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[% \textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right% ]d\lambda+\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p_{% \lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[\textbf% {M}]}-\log(\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda})\right]d\lambda.âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Î» end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) ] italic_d italic_Î» .

Given the independence of the forward process and LemmaÂ 1, the original probability pt|0â¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™0)subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™0p_{t|0}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{0})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be factorized as âˆi=1dpt|0iâ¢(xti|x0i)superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0ğ‘–conditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{t|0}^{i}(x_{t}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), where

pt|0iâ¢(xti|x0i)={1âˆ’eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t),xti=[M],eâˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t),xti=x0i,0,else.superscriptsubscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡0ğ‘–conditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–cases1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]Msuperscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–0elsep_{t|0}^{i}(x_{t}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})=\begin{cases}1-e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}^{i% }=[\textbf{M}],\\ e^{-\bar{\sigma}(t)},&x_{t}^{i}=x_{0}^{i},\\ 0,&\text{else}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG ( italic_t ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL else . end_CELL end_ROW (C.7)

Therefore, the induced probability pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)=âˆi=1dpÎ»iâ¢(xÎ»i|x0i)subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğœ†ğ‘–conditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–p_{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})=\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{\lambda}^{i}(x_% {\lambda}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) where

pÎ»iâ¢(xÎ»i|x0i)={Î»,xÎ»i=[M],1âˆ’Î»,xÎ»i=x0i,0,else.superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğœ†ğ‘–conditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–casesğœ†superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–delimited-[]M1ğœ†superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–0elsep_{\lambda}^{i}(x_{\lambda}^{i}|x_{0}^{i})=\begin{cases}\lambda,&x_{\lambda}^{% i}=[\textbf{M}],\\ 1-\lambda,&x_{\lambda}^{i}=x_{0}^{i},\\ 0,&\text{else}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_Î» , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 - italic_Î» , end_CELL start_CELL italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , end_CELL start_CELL else . end_CELL end_ROW (C.8)

Next, consider the second term in the Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î» integral. Similar to Eq.Â C.3, we can prove that it equals zero:

âˆ«011Î»â¢ğ”¼ğ’™Î»âˆ¼pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xÎ»i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡(1âˆ’Î»Î»)]=0.superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–delimited-[]M1ğœ†ğœ†0\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p_{\lambda}({% \bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log% (\frac{1-\lambda}{\lambda})\right]=0.âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Î» end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG ) ] = 0 . (C.9)

Therefore, tâ¢-DCEğ‘¡-DCEt\textrm{-DCE}italic_t -DCE loss is equivalent to the first term, which we defined as Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î»-denoising cross-entropy (Î»â¢-DCEğœ†-DCE\lambda\textrm{-DCE}italic_Î» -DCE):

â„’Î»â¢-DCETâ¢(ğ’™0)=âˆ«011Î»â¢ğ”¼ğ’™Î»âˆ¼pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘xÎ»i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™Î»UM)]â¢ğ‘‘Î».superscriptsubscriptâ„’ğœ†-DCEğ‘‡subscriptğ’™0superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğœ†ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğœ†UMdifferential-dğœ†\mathcal{L}_{\lambda\textrm{-DCE}}^{T}({\bm{x}}_{0})=\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{% \lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p_{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm% {x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{x_{\lambda}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|% {\bm{x}}_{\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambda.caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» -DCE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_Î» . (C.10)

C.3 Equivalence between lambda-DCE loss and any-order autoregressive loss

Based on Î»â¢-DCEğœ†-DCE\lambda\textrm{-DCE}italic_Î» -DCE loss in Eq.Â 3.5, we first define the sample space and analytically express the expectation term.

Given ğ’™0subscriptğ’™0{\bm{x}}_{0}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we define the sample space of ğ’™Î»subscriptğ’™ğœ†{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as ğ’³~â¢(ğ’™0):={x01,[M]}Ã—â‹¯â¢{x0d,[M]}assign~ğ’³subscriptğ’™0superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥01delimited-[]Mâ‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘‘delimited-[]M\tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0}):=\{x_{0}^{1},[\textbf{M}]\}\times\cdots\{x_{% 0}^{d},[\textbf{M}]\}over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , [ M ] } Ã— â‹¯ { italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , [ M ] } and ğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0):={ğ’™~:ğ’™~âˆˆğ’³~â¢(ğ’™0)âˆ§ğ’™~â¢has exact k dimensions with valuesÂ â¢[M]}assignsubscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0conditional-set~ğ’™~ğ’™~ğ’³subscriptğ’™0~ğ’™has exact k dimensions with valuesÂ delimited-[]M\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0}):=\{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}:\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in% \tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0})\land\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\ \text{has exact k % dimensions with values }[\textbf{M}]\}over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) := { over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG : over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âˆ§ over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG has exact k dimensions with values [ M ] } . It follows that |ğ’³~â¢(ğ’™0)|=2d~ğ’³subscriptğ’™0superscript2ğ‘‘|\tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0})|=2^{d}| over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | = 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and |ğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0)|=(dk)subscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0binomialğ‘‘ğ‘˜|\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})|=\binom{d}{k}| over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | = ( FRACOP start_ARG italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_k end_ARG ). Therefore, the sample space ğ’³~â¢(ğ’™0)~ğ’³subscriptğ’™0\tilde{\mathcal{X}}({\bm{x}}_{0})over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) can be decoupled by the number of masked tokens kğ‘˜kitalic_k in ğ’™~~ğ’™\tilde{{\bm{x}}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG:

âˆ«011Î»â¢ğ”¼ğ’™Î»âˆ¼pÎ»â¢(ğ’™Î»|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™Î»UM)]â¢ğ‘‘Î»superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscriptğ”¼similar-tosubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğœ†subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğœ†UMdifferential-dğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\mathbb{E}_{{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}\sim p% _{\lambda}({\bm{x}}_{\lambda}|{\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf% {M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|{\bm{x}}_{\lambda}^{\textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambdaâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_Î» (C.11)
=\displaystyle== âˆ«011Î»â¢âˆ‘x~âˆˆğ’³~â¢(ğ’™0)pÎ»â¢(ğ’™~|ğ’™0)â¢[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)]â¢dâ¢Î»superscriptsubscript011ğœ†subscript~ğ‘¥~ğ’³subscriptğ’™0subscriptğ‘ğœ†conditional~ğ’™subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UMğ‘‘ğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\sum_{\tilde{x}\in\tilde{\mathcal{X}% }({\bm{x}}_{0})}p_{\lambda}(\tilde{{\bm{x}}}|{\bm{x}}_{0})\left[\sum_{\tilde{x% }^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}})% \right]d\lambdaâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_Î» (C.12)
=\displaystyle== âˆ«011Î»â¢âˆ‘k=0dâˆ‘ğ’™~âˆˆğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0)Î»kâ¢(1âˆ’Î»)dâˆ’kâ¢[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)]â¢dâ¢Î»superscriptsubscript011ğœ†superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜0ğ‘‘subscript~ğ’™subscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0superscriptğœ†ğ‘˜superscript1ğœ†ğ‘‘ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UMğ‘‘ğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\sum_{k=0}^{d}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}% \in\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\lambda^{k}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}\left[% \sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{% \textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambdaâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_Î» ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_Î» (C.13)
=\displaystyle== âˆ«011Î»â¢âˆ‘k=1dâˆ‘ğ’™~âˆˆğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0)Î»kâ¢(1âˆ’Î»)dâˆ’kâ¢[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)]â¢dâ¢Î».superscriptsubscript011ğœ†superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘‘subscript~ğ’™subscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0superscriptğœ†ğ‘˜superscript1ğœ†ğ‘‘ğ‘˜delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UMğ‘‘ğœ†\displaystyle\int_{0}^{1}\frac{1}{\lambda}\sum_{k=1}^{d}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}% \in\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\lambda^{k}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}\left[% \sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{% \textrm{UM}})\right]d\lambda.âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î» end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_Î» ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] italic_d italic_Î» . (C.14)

The last equation holds because there are no masked tokens when k=0ğ‘˜0k=0italic_k = 0, and the inner sum is zero.

From Eq.Â C.14, by rearranging the order of summation and integration, we can analytically evaluate the integral âˆ«01Î»kâˆ’1â¢(1âˆ’Î»)dâˆ’kâ¢ğ‘‘Î»superscriptsubscript01superscriptğœ†ğ‘˜1superscript1ğœ†ğ‘‘ğ‘˜differential-dğœ†\int_{0}^{1}\lambda^{k-1}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}d\lambdaâˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_Î» ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_Î» using the Beta function, which eliminates Î»ğœ†\lambdaitalic_Î»:

Eq.Â C.14=Eq.Â C.14absent\displaystyle\lx@cref{creftype~refnum}{eq:lambda_k_mix}== âˆ‘k=1dâˆ«01Î»kâˆ’1â¢(1âˆ’Î»)dâˆ’kâ¢ğ‘‘Î»â¢âˆ‘ğ’™~âˆˆğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0)[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)]superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘‘superscriptsubscript01superscriptğœ†ğ‘˜1superscript1ğœ†ğ‘‘ğ‘˜differential-dğœ†subscript~ğ’™subscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\int_{0}^{1}\lambda^{k-1}(1-\lambda)^{d-k}d\lambda% \sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{% \tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{% \textrm{UM}})\right]âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_Î» ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d - italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d italic_Î» âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] (C.15)
=\displaystyle== âˆ‘k=1d(kâˆ’1)!â¢(dâˆ’k)!d!â¢âˆ‘ğ’™~âˆˆğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0)[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)]superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘‘ğ‘˜1ğ‘‘ğ‘˜ğ‘‘subscript~ğ’™subscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{(k-1)!(d-k)!}{d!}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in% \tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-% \log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}})\right]âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG ( italic_k - 1 ) ! =\displaystyle== âˆ‘k=1d1kâ¢Cdkâ¢âˆ‘ğ’™~âˆˆğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0)[âˆ‘x~i=[M]âˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)].superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘‘1ğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ¶ğ‘‘ğ‘˜subscript~ğ’™subscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{1}{kC_{d}^{k}}\sum_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\in\tilde% {\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0})}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}-\log q% _{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}})\right].âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_k italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] . (C.17)

Eq.Â C.17 can be reformulated in terms of an expectation over a uniform distribution Uâ¢(ğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0))ğ‘ˆsubscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0U(\tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0}))italic_U ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) as follows:

âˆ‘k=1d1kâ¢ğ”¼ğ’™~âˆ¼Uâ¢(ğ’³~kâ¢(ğ’™0))â¢[âˆ‘x~i=[M](âˆ’logâ¡(qÎ¸â¢(x0i|ğ’™~UM)))].superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘‘1ğ‘˜subscriptğ”¼similar-to~ğ’™ğ‘ˆsubscript~ğ’³ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™0delimited-[]subscriptsuperscript~ğ‘¥ğ‘–delimited-[]Msubscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğ‘–superscript~ğ’™UM\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{1}{k}\mathbb{E}_{\tilde{{\bm{x}}}\sim U(% \tilde{\mathcal{X}}_{k}({\bm{x}}_{0}))}\left[\sum_{\tilde{x}^{i}=[\textbf{M}]}% \left(-\log(q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{i}|\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}}))\right)\right].âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_k end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG âˆ¼ italic_U ( over~ start_ARG caligraphic_X end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ M ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( - roman_log ( italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ) ] . (C.18)

Let Ï€ğœ‹\piitalic_Ï€ be one permutation of the integers 1,â‹¯,d1â‹¯ğ‘‘1,\cdots,d1 , â‹¯ , italic_d, and UÏ€subscriptğ‘ˆğœ‹U_{\pi}italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represent the uniform distribution of all orders. We note that Eq.Â C.18 is equivalent to the following term from the perspective of any-order autoregressive model:

âˆ‘k=1d1kâ¢ğ”¼Ï€âˆ¼UÏ€â¢âˆ‘r=dâˆ’k+1dâˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0Ï€â¢(r)|x0Ï€(<dâˆ’k+1);Ï€).superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ‘‘1ğ‘˜subscriptğ”¼similar-toğœ‹subscriptğ‘ˆğœ‹superscriptsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘‘ğ‘˜1ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğœ‹ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0annotatedğœ‹absentğ‘‘ğ‘˜1ğœ‹\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{d}\frac{1}{k}\mathbb{E}_{\pi\sim U_{\pi}}\sum_{r=d-k+% 1}^{d}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{\pi(r)}|x_{0}^{\pi(<d-k+1)};\pi).âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_k end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ âˆ¼ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r = italic_d - italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( italic_r ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( < italic_d - italic_k + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Ï€ ) . (C.19)

Here, x0Ï€(<l)superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0annotatedğœ‹absentğ‘™x_{0}^{\pi(<l)}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( < italic_l ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT denotes the sequence of the first lâˆ’1ğ‘™1l-1italic_l - 1 elements in the permutation Ï€ğœ‹\piitalic_Ï€. Given a fixed kğ‘˜kitalic_k, the term x0Ï€(<dâˆ’k+1)superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0annotatedğœ‹absentğ‘‘ğ‘˜1x_{0}^{\pi(<d-k+1)}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( < italic_d - italic_k + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT can be interpreted as the unmasked part of the noisy data ğ’™~UMsuperscript~ğ’™UM\tilde{{\bm{x}}}^{\textrm{UM}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For r=dâˆ’k+1,â‹¯,dğ‘Ÿğ‘‘ğ‘˜1â‹¯ğ‘‘r=d-k+1,\cdots,ditalic_r = italic_d - italic_k + 1 , â‹¯ , italic_d, x0Ï€â¢(r)superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğœ‹ğ‘Ÿx_{0}^{\pi(r)}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( italic_r ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT corresponds to the kğ‘˜kitalic_k items of the masked part. Since both Ï€ğœ‹\piitalic_Ï€ and ğ’™~~ğ’™\tilde{{\bm{x}}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_x end_ARG are both uniformly sampled, Eq.Â C.18 and Eq.Â C.19 are equivalent.

Further, we can make a simple subscription transformation by letting l=dâˆ’k+1ğ‘™ğ‘‘ğ‘˜1l=d-k+1italic_l = italic_d - italic_k + 1 and change the summation to Monte Carlo estimation on Eq.Â C.19 :

dâ‹…ğ”¼lâˆ¼Uâ¢(1,â‹¯,d)â¢1dâˆ’l+1â¢ğ”¼Ï€âˆ¼UÏ€â¢âˆ‘r=ldâˆ’logâ¡qÎ¸â¢(x0Ï€â¢(r)|x0Ï€(<l);Ï€).â‹…ğ‘‘subscriptğ”¼similar-toğ‘™ğ‘ˆ1â‹¯ğ‘‘1ğ‘‘ğ‘™1subscriptğ”¼similar-toğœ‹subscriptğ‘ˆğœ‹superscriptsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘™ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘ğœƒconditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0ğœ‹ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥0annotatedğœ‹absentğ‘™ğœ‹\displaystyle d\cdot\mathbb{E}_{l\sim U(1,\cdots,d)}\frac{1}{d-l+1}\mathbb{E}_% {\pi\sim U_{\pi}}\sum_{r=l}^{d}-\log q_{\theta}(x_{0}^{\pi(r)}|x_{0}^{\pi(<l)}% ;\pi).italic_d â‹… blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l âˆ¼ italic_U ( 1 , â‹¯ , italic_d ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_d - italic_l + 1 end_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ âˆ¼ italic_U start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r = italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - roman_log italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î¸ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( italic_r ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ ( < italic_l ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Ï€ ) . (C.20)

InÂ [30, 31], it was proved that Eq.Â C.20 is mathematically equivalent to Eq.Â 2.16. Actually, Eq.Â C.20 is widely used as a training objective for any-order autoregressive models for efficient parallel optimization.

This concludes our proof of TheoremÂ 2.

Appendix D Sampling methods

In this section, we first derived the exact reverse distribution for absorbing discrete diffusion in SectionÂ D.1. This derivation led to simplified forms of the Tweedie Ï„ğœ\tauitalic_Ï„-leaping and Euler methods, detailed in SectionÂ D.2 and SectionÂ D.3, respectively. In SectionÂ D.4, we proved the equivalence of these two methods under a log-linear noise schedule. Finally, in SectionÂ D.5, we discussed the expected number of function evaluations (E-NFEs) for these methods.

D.1 Exact reverse distribution in absorbing discrete diffusion

Lemma 2.

(Analytic reverse distribution in absorbing diffusion) Suppose {Xt}subscriptğ‘‹ğ‘¡\{X_{t}\}{ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } is a continuous time Markov chain with transition rate matrix ğt=Ïƒâ¢(t)â¢ğabsorbsubscriptğğ‘¡ğœğ‘¡superscriptğabsorb{\bm{Q}}_{t}=\sigma(t){\bm{Q}}^{\text{absorb}}bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Ïƒ ( italic_t ) bold_italic_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT absorb end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. For ğ±t=xt1â¢â‹¯â¢xtdsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡1â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘‘{\bm{x}}_{t}=x_{t}^{1}\cdots x_{t}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with d1subscriptğ‘‘1d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT masked tokens and d2=dâˆ’d1subscriptğ‘‘2ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘‘1d_{2}=d-d_{1}italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_d - italic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT unmasked tokens, and ğ±s=xs1â¢â‹¯â¢xsdsubscriptğ±ğ‘ superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ 1â‹¯superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ ğ‘‘{\bm{x}}_{s}=x_{s}^{1}\cdots x_{s}^{d}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹¯ italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with d1âˆ’Î”â¢dsubscriptğ‘‘1Î”ğ‘‘d_{1}-\Delta ditalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_Î” italic_d masked tokens and d2+Î”â¢dsubscriptğ‘‘2Î”ğ‘‘d_{2}+\Delta ditalic_d start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” italic_d unmasked tokens, the reverse distribution is given by:

where ğ±tâŠ†UMğ±ssubscriptUMsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡subscriptğ±ğ‘ {\bm{x}}_{t}\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ† start_POSTSUBSCRIPT UM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT denotes âˆ€i::for-allğ‘–absent\forall i:âˆ€ italic_i : ğ±tiâ‰ [M]superscriptsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡ğ‘–delimited-[]M{\bm{x}}_{t}^{i}\neq[\textbf{M}]bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰  [ M ], we have ğ±ti=ğ±sisuperscriptsubscriptğ±ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ±ğ‘ ğ‘–{\bm{x}}_{t}^{i}={\bm{x}}_{s}^{i}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Proof.

Using Bayesâ€™ theorem, ps|tâ¢(ğ’™s|ğ’™t)=pt|sâ¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™s)â¢psâ¢(ğ’™s)ptâ¢(ğ’™t)subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘ ğ‘¡conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘ subscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡ğ‘ conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘ subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğ’™ğ‘ subscriptğ‘ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘¡p_{s|t}({\bm{x}}_{s}|{\bm{x}}_{t})=p_{t|s}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{s})\frac{p_{% s}({\bm{x}}_{s})}{p_{t}({\bm{x}}_{t})}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s | italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG.

From PropositionÂ 1:

Utilizing Eq.Â B.12, we get

pt|sâ¢(ğ’™t|ğ’™s)=âˆi=1dpt|siâ¢(xti|xsi)={[eâˆ’(ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)âˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(s))]d2â¢[1âˆ’eâˆ’(ÏƒÂ¯â¢(t)âˆ’ÏƒÂ¯â¢(s))]Î”â¢d,ğ’™tâŠ†UMğ’™s,0,ğ’™tâŠˆUMğ’™s.subscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡ğ‘ conditionalsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘ superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘conditionalğ‘¡ğ‘ ğ‘–conditionalsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¥ğ‘ ğ‘–casessuperscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡Â¯ğœğ‘ subscriptğ‘‘2superscriptdelimited-[]1superscriptğ‘’Â¯ğœğ‘¡Â¯ğœğ‘ Î”ğ‘‘subscriptUMsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘ 0subscriptnot-subset-of-or-equalsUMsubscriptğ’™ğ‘¡subscriptğ’™ğ‘ p_{t|s}({\bm{x}}_{t}|{\bm{x}}_{s})=\prod_{i=1}^{d}p_{t|s}^{i}(x_{t}^{i}|x_{s}^% {i})=\begin{cases}\left[e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)\right)}% \right]^{d_{2}}\left[1-e^{-\left(\bar{\sigma}(t)-\bar{\sigma}(s)\right)}\right% ]^{\Delta d},&{\bm{x}}_{t}\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s},\\ 0,&{\bm{x}}_{t}\not\subseteq_{\text{UM}}{\bm{x}}_{s}.\end{cases}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t | italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = { start_ROW start_CELL [ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -
